1: How long, Lord, will you continue to ignore me?[b] How long will you pay no attention to me?[c]
2: How long must I worry,[d] and suffer in broad daylight?[e] How long will my enemy gloat over me?[f]
3: Look at me![g] Answer me, O Lord my God! Revive me,[h] or else I will die.[i]
4: Then[j] my enemy will say, “I have defeated him.” Then[k] my foes will rejoice because I am shaken.
5: But I[l] trust in your faithfulness. May I rejoice because of your deliverance.[m]
6: I will sing praises[n] to the Lord when he vindicates me.[o]
